action_collect.desc: Humans discovered they could augment earth's resources by collecting materials from outer space. Life became much better on earth when we automated the collection system for earth resources. Our ship captains think we can come up with some sort of protocol to automatically collect resources in space. Automating this process could be dangerous, but also rewarding.
action_collect.info: Have collection ships automate the collection system using new AI
action_collect.name: action_collect
action_collect.title: Automatic Resource Collection

action_cta.desc: Communication systems on board the ships are fully holographic and provide instant communication. Our captains have been studying up, and we believe that we can provide you with a faster way to muster our forces. Using newer and simpler protocols should allow us to rally our military ships much faster.
action_cta.info: Allows you to select all combat ships
action_cta.name: action_cta
action_cta.title: Call To Action

action_refine.desc: While highly experimental, subatomic particle reconfiguration could prove to be incredibly valuable. Especially with the number of asteroids we've encountered. We are confident that we can create a working prototype, but the it will require a very specific type of ship.
action_refine.info: A material refining ship with some material storage.
action_refine.name: action_refine
action_refine.title: Refining

action_repair.desc: Nanites actually store the blueprint of the entire ship, much like DNA stores how a human should be built. Programming nanotech to build ships is one thing, but with a blueprint diff process, we should be able to get the nanites to repair our ships as well.
action_repair.info: Have ships automatically start repairing with a Nanites AI upgrade.
action_repair.name: action_repair
action_repair.title: Ship Repair

action_salvage.desc: Most space salvage consists of destroyed or broken components. That being said, we're really good at making ships and we're good at blowing them up. What we're not so good at is taking ships apart and salvaging them. I think we can reverse the nanotech process to take apart ships without much waste.
action_salvage.info: Salvage your own ships by recycling them to build new ships
action_salvage.name: action_salvage
action_salvage.title: Salvage Ships

build_satellite.desc: In an effort to provide more information on the battlefield, we have figured out how to make a satellite that is small enough to not go on main sensors, but still provide information to the fleet.
build_satellite.info: An immobile satellite that provides vision that can't be seen by the enemy.
build_satellite.name: build_satellite
build_satellite.title: Build Satellite

build_advdrydock.desc: At one point in history, humans created a self-replicating drydock. They ran out of materials rather quickly. Regardless, if you want bigger ships, you're going to have to build bigger drydocks.
build_advdrydock.info: A construction ship that can build advanced ships.
build_advdrydock.name: build_advdrydock
build_advdrydock.title: Build Advanced Drydock

build_artillery.desc: We can create an artillery class ship designed for long range. This way we can keep the heavy armored ships in the front, and blast them from a distance. I'm told that this ship is basically just a modified howitzer.
build_artillery.info: A long ranged combat ship to defend your squadron with.
build_artillery.name: build_artillery
build_artillery.title: Build a Artillery Vessel

build_cargo.desc: After humans began colonizing other planets, cargo vessels became a necessity. If we're running out of room, I guess we could just build a giant hangar, and attach some engines to it. Should provide a good way to stockpile materials, assuming it doesn't get blown up.
build_cargo.info: A cargo ship that stores ore and material.
build_cargo.name: build_cargo
build_cargo.title: Build a Freighter

build_combat.desc: One of the largest warship classes is the Galactica class warship. A sturdy design that has lasted the trials of time. We realize that the small fighter doesn't really have staying power in combat, so we made a bigger one. Bigger is better, right?
build_combat.info: A combat ship to defend your squadron with.
build_combat.name: build_combat
build_combat.title: Build Battlestar

build_command.desc: The pride and joy of any exploratory fleet, this vessel contains everything one needs to survive in the depths of space. As well as providing basic construction, freight storage and housing facilities, this vessel is a closed ecological system. Assuming major functions aren't disrupted, this ship can last forever. Ships like this, will be with you 'til the day you die.
build_command.info: The main construction ship with some material storage.
build_command.name: build_command
build_command.title: Build Command Ship

build_drydock.desc: In classic warfare, military depended on supply lines. By removing this obstacle, humans were able to wage war on a whole new level. Right now we can only build basic ships. If we could build a drydock larger than the one in the command hanger, we should be able to step up our game.
build_drydock.info: A construction ship that can build basic ships.
build_drydock.name: build_drydock
build_drydock.title: Build Drydock

build_fighter.desc: I think we can make a venerable one man space superior fighter based on the stiletto and viper class fighters. While they may be outdated at this point, in large numbers, they can be effective. In all technicality, we're pretty much strapping our young men and women to a combination of rockets, bathtubs and guns. That's ok, I never liked them anyway.
build_fighter.info: A small combat ship to defend your squadron with.
build_fighter.name: build_fighter
build_fighter.title: Build Fighter

build_habitat.desc: Habitats are essential, not only for moral, but to serve as living quarters for civilians. People have been living in space for so long, they have begun to associate habitats with home. If we optimize the layouts on the habitat, we should be able to sustain a faster growth rate.
build_habitat.info: A bio-dome that produces crew and can pick up crew from stations.
build_habitat.name: build_habitat
build_habitat.title: Build Habitat

build_jump.desc: The jumpship operates by creating a wormhole that allows mass to move through folded space. The jump ship is a very advanced piece of technology, but by carefully looking into how ours is designed, I think we can recreate a blueprint. The more we have, the quicker we can calculate our jump as they all will fold space together, creating a faster larger wormhole.
build_jump.info: A jump ship that will allow your fleet to jump to the next system faster.
build_jump.name: build_jump
build_jump.title: Build Jumpgate Generator

build_mining.desc: Mining has been a respected occupation for many generations. If you want to collect ore to refine into minerals, you're going to need some kind of ship to mine it. It's pretty basic, but it will get the job done! Keep in mind that this ship will not refine the ore; you'll need a refinery for that.
build_mining.info: An ore mining ship with some ore storage.
build_mining.name: build_mining
build_mining.title: Build Mining Rig

build_radar.desc: The XS-45 was originally commissioned as a low cost civilian reconnaissance ship, but after a few years of crowdsourced development, it became an incredibly popular vessel. The military originally opened up bids for the creation of an advanced reconnaissance ship. The project met the specifications and won the research and development bid with a $0 budget. Hence renamed the XS-45, this vessel is now a staple in fleets and is in practical military use.
build_radar.info: A scanning ship with a large visual range.
build_radar.name: build_radar
build_radar.title: Build Radar

build_refinery.desc: Subatomic particle reconfiguration may be pretty awesome, as it allows us to process any ore, but it's really dangerous as well. I've reviewed the currently available ships in our fleet, and none of them will be capable of running such a system. We need to design a ship that can process ore, and is safe enough for common use, a member of the research team has a blueprint we can try
build_refinery.info: A material refining ship with some material storage.
build_refinery.name: build_refinery
build_refinery.title: Build Refinery

build_research.desc: If you are looking to gain the edge against the enemies, you're going to want some advanced upgrades. Of course for complicated science stuff you're going to need complex science ships. Between you and me, I don't want those scientists on board my ship. They keep going on about science collaboration points.
build_research.info: A research ship used to advance your fleet.
build_research.name: build_research
build_research.title: Build a Research Facility

build_salvager.desc: Salvagers are quite common nowadays, as space is a dangerous place to venture. This is a basic vulture ship designed to pick up scrap from destroyed enemies. It is a simple design, gets the job done and it's cheap to build. We should probably avoid putting claustrophobic folks in these guys.
build_salvager.info: A ship used to gather salvage from destroyed ships.
build_salvager.name: build_salvager
build_salvager.title: Build Salvager

build_tank.desc: Our current vehicles have many layers of armor to prevent folks from getting sucked out into space the second we take a bit of damage, but we can do better. So I had the boys down in research figure out how we can keep our ships up and running longer, faster and harder. A lot of good ideas came up, but the best was to build a wall around the fleet. We did the math, and it was cost prohibitive, so we think we can just build a wall around one of the ships, a wall of extra armor that is.
build_tank.info: A combat ship with a lot of health to defend your squadron with.
build_tank.name: build_tank
build_tank.title: Build Armored Frontline Tank

build_troopship.desc: Some ships are designed to penetrate an enemy hull, and provide an opening so we can have a small group of folks take a ship by force. Some of the troops are just climbing up the walls, and that's not even with the artificial gravity disabled. I think we can build a ship that would basically provide a one way trip into neutral or enemy vessels. Don't worry, we'll give them big guns. The ship? Not at all.
build_troopship.info: A vessal used to take over neutral ships or damaged enemy ships.
build_troopship.name: build_troopship
build_troopship.title: Build Troopship

upgrade_armor.desc: Our armor uses a tight mesh system that maintains an incredible strength and is also lightweight. We have been studying the enemy, and have been able to come up with an adaptive armor plating system that should help deflect damage from foes. While it will not stop damage, it should be effective against their weapon systems.
upgrade_armor.name: upgrade_armor
upgrade_armor.title: Upgrade Ship Armor

upgrade_build_time.desc: Nanotechnology is practically a necessity in space, and it has shown to be well suited for ship development. The only available codebase is an older version, but it works for the most part. Sometimes it bugs out and confuses people with material. I'm sure if we put some developers onto the task, we can fix those bugs and increase the efficiency of the algorithm. Or maybe add more bugs.
upgrade_build_time.name: upgrade_build_time
upgrade_build_time.title: Upgrade Build Speed

upgrade_crew.desc: The human race has been cloning humans for centuries now, but it is still common to make children "the old fashioned way". While highly unethical, we've found we can increase the maturity rate of the cloning process. If you need more crew, we can research this. The ends justify the means, I suppose.
upgrade_crew.info: Modify crew clones to grow faster.
upgrade_crew.name: upgrade_crew
upgrade_crew.title: Upgrade Habitat Crew

upgrade_damage.desc: Based on the distant relative IRIS-T Air to Air missile, the FSIS-J (Full Spectrum Imaging System - Jet controlled vector) this battle-proven missile has shown to be nearly 100% effective in vacuum. On top of being easy to make, the weapon's payload is difficult to modify as the AI simulation has to be re-calculated and tested.
upgrade_damage.name: upgrade_damage
upgrade_damage.title: Upgrade Ship Damage

upgrade_fow.desc: Thanks to it's open and modular design, upgrading hardware systems on the XS-45 has never been easier. With a small investment we can easily reconfigure our more advanced military scanners into the design. Operating these scanners in parallel should provide an enormous scanning range.
upgrade_fow.name: upgrade_fow
upgrade_fow.title: Upgrade Radar Range

upgrade_jump.desc: Jump computers inside jump ships calculate the position in space that needs to be folded to transport mass. Our jump computers are out of date, but I think we can upgrade them. If we can manage to get some more flops out of it, we should be able to traverse sectors quicker.
upgrade_jump.name: upgrade_jump
upgrade_jump.title: Upgrade Jump Calculation Speed

upgrade_mining.desc: By using Ablation V6 lasers, we can easily harvest precious metals from nearby asteroids. We are experiencing a few bottlenecks in our mining rigs. We believe we can fix them by introducing redundant backup systems. No more coffee breaks!
upgrade_mining.info: Increase mining speed on all mining ships.
upgrade_mining.name: upgrade_mining
upgrade_mining.title: Upgrade Mining Speed

upgrade_range.desc: Our sensors are based on quantum entanglement scanners, using the "ghosting" phenomenon to track almost invisible enemies. We have been scanning the enemies we have encountered, and it seems like they emit a very weak electromagnetic signature. We should be able to update the targeting systems on our missiles to better hone in on them, thus increasing our range.
upgrade_range.name: upgrade_range
upgrade_range.title: Upgrade Ship Attack Range

upgrade_refine.desc: Since most materials in space tend to be a variety of types of metal, it's important to refine and reduce these materials into a common material of some sort. Akin to alchemy, the process alters atoms at an subatomic level to create the materials required. With some scientific "trial and error" we are confident we can improve the efficiency of the refining process. We believe we can streamline this process to make it faster.
upgrade_refine.name: upgrade_refine
upgrade_refine.title: Upgrade Refining Speed

upgrade_repair.desc: Nanites are tiny little robots that can create highly complex objects from ordinary matter. Our nanites repair our ships, but I think by applying some AI rerouting, we can improve the efficiency of the algorithms.
upgrade_repair.name: upgrade_repair
upgrade_repair.title: Upgrade Ship Repair

upgrade_salvage.desc: Salvagers use concentrated magnets to grab and sort debris. By altering the design of the salvager's claws, I think we can increase the speed at which the salvager can collect debris. There is still nothing I can do to help out the claustrophobic drivers.
upgrade_salvage.name: upgrade_salvage
upgrade_salvage.title: Upgrade Salvage Speed

upgrade_speed.desc: Modern propulsion uses a recyclable jet fuel to propel the ship through space. Sometimes winning isn't just about how hard you can hit, but how quickly you can avoid the enemy. We think we can increase the compression rate on our jet engines. If we can figure out an optimal rate, I think we can boost the entire fleet's speed.
upgrade_speed.name: upgrade_speed
upgrade_speed.title: Upgrade Ship Speed
